intro: Stylochaeton chevalieri, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its flowers are typically followed by follicles that contain seeds with tufts of hair for wind dispersal. Stylochaeton chevalieri is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
